name: Days Inn Stone Mountain

reviews.text: Stayed here 4 nights while visiting Stone Mountain a few weeks ago. Had reserved the room for only 3 nights but arrived a day ahead and thanks to the manager, we were able to secure the same room a night earlier. Room was clean & staff was very helpful. Plenty of soft & fluffy towels in the bathroom. After checking in, staff called & asked if room was suitable and if anything was needed. Parking lot and area was very well lit. Close to everything & not far to drive to any attractions or places of interest. Reasonable rates also. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: Stayed here 3 nights while visiting Atlanta. great location...close enought to Atlanta but yet far enough away from the hustle of the big city. Room was great and hotel staff was good. A+ to Kelly at the front desk..she was awesome. if ever back in Atlanta will stay here again...
reviews.title: Nice Atlanta Getaway location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here over Labor Day weekend and was very happy. The location was excellent (1/2 to Stone Mountain Park), We arrived a day earlier than we had expected and the manager was very accommodating. He switched some rooms around so that we were able to stay in the same room for all 3 nights and made sure we had a non-smoking room. The room was very clean.
reviews.title: Great Customer Service & Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Days Inn Stone Mountain on our vacation to the area in June, 2011. We wanted to visit Stone Mountain and also some Atlanta attractions. This is a perfect place to stay for that! You're only minutes from Stone Mountain Park, and yet you're not far at all from Atlanta. This motel has much better rates than if you stayed inside Stone Mountain Park.
reviews.title: Good Motel with Good Prices

reviews.text: We found the employees to be very helpful and friendly. My husband had the opportunity to talk with the manager. It's obvious that he cares that you have a good experience while staying with them!
reviews.title: Just the Facts

reviews.text: The main thing that stands out about this hotel to me is the beds. They were SO comfortable! I've stayed in many hotels, this hotel had one of the best mattresses! The front desk was very friendly. The cleaning staff did not speak English very well, so when they asked if we wanted the room cleaned and I said "Can you come back later?" They didn't really understand me. So I asked for more towels, they didn't understand that either. I just went to the front desk to get some more towels. The shower was nice, water got very hot. Breakfast only offered bagels and cereal, but it was better than nothing.
reviews.title: Not bad for the cost

reviews.text: The room is clean and comfortable. When we checked into our room we noticed the tub faucet was leaking. We called the front desk and they immediately sent someone to take a look at it. It was fixed in no time. Close to Atlanta. Nice staff and nice breakfast.
reviews.title: View of Stone Mountain!

reviews.text: Clean, friendly staff, very low price, free breakfast, free USA today, microwave / frige / coffeemaker /iron + board / shampoo / hairdryer in room.
reviews.title: View of Stone Mountain

reviews.text: No frills-just right.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay for the price.

reviews.text: I like that is has an outside room entrance so you can park right by your door and unload.
reviews.title: Very good for location and money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel, along with 10 others, during April 2012 as part of a 17 day road trip across GA, NC, SC. By giving the star rating I am not saying the hotel is a 3 star but whether it was clean and value for the money and to an extent we have compared then to the other 10 hotels we stayed at.
reviews.title: Just about

reviews.text: This was the motel type where your room door opens onto the car park and maybe is not as safe as a traditional hotel. On the other hand you can park directly outside your room and just be careful.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: On arrival we were allocated a twin queen size bedded room which was clean, clean towels and a pretty bad leak from the hand basin.
reviews.title: Not very clean..
No way will we be staying here again
reviews.text: The included breakfast was the usual offering of cereal, toast and coffee and just about OK.
At about £42 per night it was OK but not as good value as the Days Inn at Asheville where we had just travelled from. On balance I would not stay here again if I had a choice.
reviews.title: they are renovating but doing it quietly

reviews.text: We knew that we were not staying at the Taj Mahal! I also knew that we were on a family vacation to visit Stone Mountain and would not be spending a lot of time in the room. So we decided on a cheaper hotel with not a lot of amenities and were just hoping that it would be clean. Well, Days Inn definitely met our expectations! The room was definitely clean, beds were comfortable enough, kids enjoyed the pool and we enjoyed the close proximity to Stone Mountain. There were many eating places very nearby. The General Manager Anant Patel is a very gracious host. He even made oatmeal for my daughter and gave her a bottle of honey to use! We would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: this place was what we wanted 3 mins from stone mountain park, very resonable price, not ran down, great location and employees......would stay there agian with out doubt !!
reviews.title: fourth of july 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: clean and very courteous staff...housekeeper even straightened our shoes and provided me with an extra regular coffee when she noticed that I didn't drink decaf. Very --conveniently located just needed to ignore my GPS and ask the hotel staff the best route to from downtown area.
reviews.title: perfect getaway

reviews.text: We booked ahead of time online, had no trouble when we arrived checking in. room was clean, kids loved the pool. very close to stone mt. park, and several food places, we would absolutely stay again .
reviews.title: We had great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there for one night to visit Stone Mountain park. The location was great, just a short drive, well singposted. The receptionist on duty was a really friendly guy, he likened himself to Manuel from Faulty Towers but only to look at I would add. He was very welcoming and kindly told how to drive to Stone Mountain even telling us which lanes to be in. The room was clean and had plenty of towels and soaps etc. Also Applebees is right across the road and the staff there were really nice esp. the young woman who served us.
reviews.title: Great stay and good value

aka: Days Inn Stone Mountain Hotel Stone Mountain
